@graph.description: Using just one pot and (instant!) ramen noodles—just the noodles, toss that sodium-bomb flavor packet—makes this vegetarian coconut curry ramen a quick and easy dinner.
@graph.headline: Coconut Curry Ramen Recipe
@graph.keywords: coconut curry ramen,    spring, summer, fall, winter, diary-free, vegan, vegetarian, 30-minute-meals, one-pot-meals
@graph.name: Coconut Curry Ramen Recipe
@graph.recipeCategory: lunch, dinner, diary-free, vegan, vegetarian, 30-minute-meals, one-pot-meals
recipeIngredient: 1 bunch green onions, white and green parts, thinly sliced, divided
2 (3 oz) packages dried ramen noodles, (discard spice packet)

recipeInstructions.text: Make the six minute eggs (if using), set aside
In a large pot over medium heat, whisk the red curry paste, yellow curry powder, sesame oil, garlic and ginger until fragrant, about 3 minutes
Add the stock, coconut milk, white and light green parts of green onion (reserve the dark green parts for garnish), ramen noodles, mushrooms, lime juice, bok choy and salt
Add the shelled edamame and boil for 2 minutes longer, until noodles are cooked
Divide the ramen into 2-4 bowls, garnish with remaining scallion tops, sesame seeds and halved, six-minute eggs (if using)

review.reviewBody: Recipe was lovely, did it with bokchoy, green onions, and fried mushrooms. Also had the 6-minute egg and some sliced chicken. Broth could use a little more curry powder and thai paste than the suggested amount.Definitely one for the incoming cold weather.

Yum! This was so easy. I read the reviews before making this recipe but already had Thai Kitchen brand of curry paste in my fridge, so I just doubled the amount that i used and it was great. We threw in some leftover pulled-pork too. I’m now eating it for leftovers and have decided that this recipe will be great for when we’re all back to working and need quick weeknight meals. :-)
